com.ethanzeigler.jgamegui

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ethanzeigler.jgamegui.Window

  • public class Window
extends java.lang.Object
    A window to draw to. Elements can be added to the window.

    • Field Summary

      • removeElement

        public boolean removeElement(AbstractElement e)
        Removes the ImageElement from the window.
        Parameters:
        e - ImageElement to remove
        Returns:
        true if ImageElement was removed from the list of Elements

      • removeAllElements

        public void removeAllElements()
        Removes all Elements from the window

      • getElements

        public java.util.List<AbstractElement> getElements()
        Returns the elements inside the window
        Returns:
        the elements inside the window

      • updateDrawPriorities

        public void updateDrawPriorities()
        Updates the order Elements are called in. This is called when either add or remove element are called, but if priorities are changed within an element this must be called to update the drawing order.

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints the window to the given graphics object
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics to paint to

      • runTick

        public void runTick()
        Backend method for delegating actions to be taken on a tick update.

      • runMouseClick

        Runs the appropriate actions when the mouse is clicked on the window
        Parameters:
        e - the MouseEvent

      • setDimensions

        public void setDimensions(int width,
                          int height)
        Sets the width and the height of the Window. It will override the size specified by JGameGUI
        Parameters:
        width - the width to display
        height - the height to display

      • getWidth

        public java.lang.Integer getWidth()
        Gets the width of the Window when it is being displayed on screen.
        Returns:
        the window width

      • getHeight

        public java.lang.Integer getHeight()
        Gets the height of the Window when it is being displayed on screen.
        Returns:
        the window height. Null if not set.
